sn55.35:4.1: “Mendicants, these four footprints of the gods are in order to purify unpurified beings and cleanse unclean beings.
sn55.35:5.2: Firstly, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha:
sn55.35:5.3: ‘That Blessed One is perfect, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme trainer of people, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
sn55.35:5.6: ‘What now is the footprint of the gods?’
sn55.35:5.8: ‘I hear that these days the gods consider non-harming to be supreme.
sn55.35:5.9: But I don’t hurt any creature firm or frail.
sn55.35:5.10: I definitely live in possession of a footprint of the gods.’
sn55.35:5.11: This is the first footprint of the gods in order to purify unpurified beings and cleanse unclean beings.
sn55.35:6.1: Furthermore, a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the teaching …
sn55.35:7.1: Furthermore, a noble disciple’s ethical conduct is loved by the noble ones, unbroken, unflawed, unblemished, untainted, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to samādhi.
sn55.35:7.4: ‘What now is the footprint of the gods?’
sn55.35:7.6: ‘I hear that these days the gods consider non-harming to be supreme.
sn55.35:7.7: But I don’t hurt any creature firm or frail.
sn55.35:7.8: I definitely live in possession of a footprint of the gods.’
sn55.35:7.9: This is the fourth footprint of the gods in order to purify unpurified beings and cleanse unclean beings.
sn55.35:7.10: These four footprints of the gods are in order to purify unpurified beings and cleanse unclean beings.”
